title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.3 - Permit to sell alcoholic beverages or warehouse receipts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.3 - Permit to sell alcoholic beverages or warehouse receipts

State Regulations
(a) Each application for a permit to sell
alcoholic beverages must be accompanied by a typewritten inventory, signed by
the applicant, listing the quantity, brand name, type of alcoholic beverages
and the size of the containers. (b) Each application by a bank to sell warehouse receipts must be accompanied by a
typewritten list, signed by the applicant, listing the name of the company
which issued the warehouse receipts, the certificate number, serial number and
gallonage of each barrel or case of whiskey represented by such receipts and
the place where such liquor is stored. (c) Each application by a sheriff, marshal, trustee, receiver, executor, etc., to sell alcoholic beverages which came into
his possession under a court order must be accompanied by a copy of the
execution, if a marshal or sheriff; certified copy of the court order
authorizing such sale, if a trustee or receiver in bankruptcy or assignee for
the benefit of creditors; certified copy of letters testamentary or
administration, if an executor or administrator. Notes

33.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
